alfredsnippet.snippet:
Thomas Gold, J. of Sci. Exploration, Vol. 3, No. 2, p.103-112, 1989

"I suppose that the best that I can think of is roughly on the lines of what my friend, Arthur Katrowitz proposed at least for major decisions: The 'science court' idea is the best one. Where a lot is at stake, where a subject has been driven into an alley, one must set up a science court where the different viewpoints would be heard, would be argued by the protagonists of each one, with carefully prepared work ..."

(cont'd)
alfredsnippet.name: Phys.org Post - Thomas Gold on the Science Court - Part 1
